message_1: In a topology space X, if every subset containing exactly two points can be separated by open sets, then X satisfies which separation axiom?
message_2:
If every subset containing exactly two points can be separated by open sets in a topological space X, then X satisfies the T1 separation axiom (also known as the Frechet space). 

The T1 separation axiom states that for any two distinct points x and y in X, there exist open sets U and V such that x ∈ U, y ∉ U, and y ∈ V, x ∉ V. In other words, singletons {x} and {y} are closed sets in X.
